page.title: 04Bunce (Ashbury) Ltd.
page.content: Mr William Bunce began Bunce's at The Cottage,Chapel Lane Ashbury in 1896.Mr Bunce first started as a blacksmith.The new Bunce's is in Idstone Road.There are 14 rooms in Bunce's all of them are made of breeze blocks.There is dust and concrete on the floor .The area of Bunces new extension is 9500 square feet.45 people work at Bunce's 41 men and 4 women.The most popular transport to get to work is by car.They make snowploughs,gritters,sweeper and snowblowers.The ploughs are made of steel and plastic.The funniest place that a snowplough has been sent is to the Middle East.The machinery that BunceÂ£s make are yellow .The most expensive snowblower costs about 18000 pounds.
